ygData.subject: equilibrate vs.  reactor model
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I was attempting to find the time to equilibrium using a reactor model with 1 inlet and 1 outlet.  I set the supply T,P,X and keep the pressure constant

Subject: equilibrate vs.  reactor model

Hi,

    I was attempting to find the time to equilibrium using a reactor 
model with 1 inlet and 1 outlet.  I set the supply T,P,X and keep the 
pressure constant with a flexible wall (K=10^9).  Then I made a loop 
to update the volume until it matches a specific residence time in 
the reactor:
            while dtres>tres/100:
##                n=n+1
##                print n
                R=Reactor(gas,volume=vol)
                IN=MassFlowController(S,R,mdot=0.3)
                OUT=MassFlowController(R,E,mdot=0.3)
                Xfer=Wall(R,E,K=10^9)
                RN=ReactorNet([S,R,E])
                RN.advance(10000)
                tres_calc=gas.density()*R.volume()/.3
                dtres=abs(tres_calc-tres)
                vol=.3/gas.density()*tres
            print gas.temperature(),gas.pressure(),gas.moleFraction
('NO'),gas.moleFraction('CO'),gas.moleFraction('CH4'),gas.moleFraction
('CO2')

Then I compare this value to the equilibrium value (I've tried 
solver=1,2,3 and different tolerances... they all produce an answer 
withint the tolerance)  

The mole fractions that come out of the reactor model never reaches 
or approaches the value given by the equilibrium calculation.  Also, 
and more importantly, there is a jump in the concentrations and 
temperature of the reactor at approximately 1 second. The jump 
significant for all of the values I have been keeping track of, and 
orders of magnitude for NO and CO.

I can understand why the reactor model as I have it set up may be 
different from the equilibrate, but why is there a jump in TPX around 
1 second of residence time in the reactor?  I'm not sure I've 
described my situation completely, if you like I can send you the 
python script and excel plots.  Thanks

Scott
